questions.explanation: When making a left turn where there is approaching traffic, you must wait for the approaching traffic to go through before you turn. You may enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green and no other vehicle ahead of you plans to make a left turn.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead.
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing ahead.
questions.answerC: Pedestrians must not cross here.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to where pedestrians may be crossing. If a pedestrian is crossing in a crosswalk marked with this sign, drivers must stop and remain stopped until the pedestrian is no longer in the crosswalk.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Roundabout ahead.
questions.answerB: No passing zone.
questions.answerC: Left turn yield on green.
questions.explanation: This sign means that a traffic signal is ahead. You should slow down and be prepared to stop.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No U-turn.
questions.answerB: Traffic signal ahead.
questions.answerC: Railroad ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited.

questions.question: A solid yellow arrow on a traffic signal means:
questions.answerA: You should speed up so you can make the turn before the light changes.
questions.answerB: You do not need to signal to turn from the indicated lane.
questions.answerC: You should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow arrow means that the protection of a green arrow is ending. If you are turning in the direction of the arrow, you should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic before turning.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.answerB: Slow-moving vehicle.
questions.answerC: No U-turn.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates parking spaces that are reserved for vehicles displaying Persons with Disabilities license plates, Disabled Veteran license plates, and/or disabled parking placards.

questions.question: Streets and highways are most slippery:
questions.answerA: When it has been raining hard for several hours.
questions.answerB: When they are clean and dry.
questions.answerC: Just after it starts to rain.
questions.explanation: Driving during the first half hour of rainfall is dangerous because roadways become extremely slippery when the water mixes with oil and other chemicals on the road surfaces that have not yet washed away. Use extra caution when driving on slippery roads.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You should stop for other traffic.
questions.answerB: Traffic is entering from another road and you should allow additional space for drivers to merge safely into the flow of traffic.
questions.answerC: Traffic is entering from another road and you should keep right.
questions.explanation: This sign alerts you to the possibility of traffic merging into the main stream of travel. After checking to your side and rear, you should move into another lane, if possible, to allow merging motorists a clear path.

questions.question: Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
questions.answerA: Are making a turn.
questions.answerB: Have your emergency brake on.
questions.answerC: Are changing lanes.
questions.explanation: Your vehicle's brake lights indicate to other drivers that you are slowing down or stopping. Your brake lights should always be in working order when you are driving on any roadway.

questions.question: If you are involved in a serious motor vehicle crash:
questions.answerA: Stop.
questions.answerB: Call the police.
questions.answerC: Determine if anyone is injured.
questions.explanation: If you are involved in a crash, move your vehicle off of the road and stop, if possible. If anyone is injured, call 911 and provide appropriate help. You must report the crash to law enforcement if there is an injury, a death, and/or more than $1,000 in property damage (or more than $200 worth of damage made to non-vehicle government property, such as signs or guardrails).

questions.question: You can help keep the driver behind you a safe distance away from your vehicle by:
questions.answerA: Driving 10 mph faster than the car behind you.
questions.answerB: Driving 10 mph slower than the car behind you.
questions.answerC: Maintaining a steady speed.
questions.explanation: It is not always easy to maintain a safe distance behind your vehicle. However, you can help keep the driver behind you a safe distance away from your vehicle by maintaining a steady speed and signaling turns, lane changes, and deceleration in advance.

questions.question: This symbol is used for:
questions.answerA: Dangerous intersections.
questions.answerB: Slow-moving vehicles.
questions.answerC: Yield signs.
questions.explanation: A reflective orange triangle on the rear of a vehicle means it travels only at slow speeds. You may see this sign on roadwork equipment, farm vehicles, or horse-drawn wagons and carriages. It appears as a solid orange triangle during the day and a hollow red triangle at night.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: One-way traffic.
questions.answerB: Divided highway ahead.
questions.answerC: Two-way traffic.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This warning sign indicates that drivers are about to encounter a divided highway.

questions.question: Before turning, you should:
questions.answerA: Use your signal.
questions.answerB: Turn the wheel.
questions.answerC: Increase your speed.
questions.explanation: To complete a turn safely, you should activate your turn signal three to four seconds before your turn.

questions.question: What should a driver do when approaching a traffic control signal that is not in operation?
questions.answerA: Come to a full stop and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.
questions.answerB: If the intersection is clear, the driver does not need to stop.
questions.answerC: Drive quickly through the intersection to get out of the way of other vehicles.
questions.explanation: When traffic control signals are not working, a driver must always treat the intersection as an all-way stop and come to a complete stop, unless otherwise directed by law enforcement. The driver must then look and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.

questions.question: You may not park:
questions.answerA: On a hill.
questions.answerB: In a parking lot.
questions.answerC: On a crosswalk or in a marked bicycle lane.
questions.answerD: Within 12 inches of the right side of the road.
questions.explanation: There are a number of locations where it is unlawful to park, including on a crosswalk or in a marked bicycle lane. When parking on the street, you must be within 12 inches of the side of the road.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Do not enter.
questions.answerB: No parking.
questions.answerC: No U-turn.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits drivers from making a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Trucks are permitted on an upcoming narrow bridge.
questions.answerB: The bridge ahead is open to one-way traffic only.
questions.answerC: The bridge ahead is wide enough for only one car at a time.
questions.answerD: The bridge ahead may be too narrow to meet or pass a truck.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazardous conditions and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that an upcoming bridge may be too narrow to meet or pass a truck and that they should be careful.

questions.question: At an intersection with stop signs on all corners, to whom must you yield the right-of-way?
questions.answerA: All drivers who got there before you.
questions.answerB: The driver on your right, regardless of who got there first.
questions.answerC: The driver on your left, regardless of who got there first.
questions.answerD: The driver across the intersection from you, regardless of who go there first.
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, the vehicle that reaches the intersection first moves forward first. If two or more vehicles arrive at the same time, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: You are required to report an accident when there is ____ worth of damage to anyone's property.
questions.explanation: You must report an accident to a law enforcement agency if there is an injury, a death, or damage worth $1,000 or more to any one person’s property. You must also report a crash if there is damage valuing $200 or more made to government property (such as signs and guard rails).

questions.question: What color are pavement markings that separate traffic lanes moving in opposite direction?
questions.answerA: Yellow
questions.answerB: White
questions.answerC: Yellow and white
questions.explanation: Yellow lines are used in the center of the road to separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.

questions.question: You must stop at a railroad crossing when:
questions.answerA: Directed to do so by a flagger.
questions.answerB: It is controlled by a stop sign.
questions.answerC: Flashing red signals and gates are present and operating.
questions.explanation: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger or stop sign. Stop when flashing red signals and gates are present and operating.

questions.question: If you are driving on a highway next to a single broken white line marking:
questions.answerA: You cannot cross the line to pass.
questions.answerB: You may cross the line to pass and change lanes.
questions.answerC: You may only cross the line to change lanes if you are in the left lane.
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction. You may cross a dashed white line to pass or change lanes if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When riding in a vehicle, small children:
questions.answerA: May be safely held by a strong adult.
questions.answerB: Will be safe if they are standing on the floor in the back of the vehicle.
questions.answerC: Will not be hurt in an accident because they are small.
questions.answerD: Must never be allowed to ride while standing in the vehicle.
questions.explanation: Special child seats are available for children who are too small to wear regular safety belts. No person is strong enough to safely hold onto a child of any size during an accident or sudden stop. Never allow a child to ride in a vehicle unless they are properly fastened into a seat.

questions.question: Which of the following is a dangerous habit when driving in work zones?
questions.answerA: Tailgating another vehicle
questions.answerB: Failing to carefully watch for workers and moving equipment
questions.answerC: Both of the above
questions.explanation: When driving in a work zone, adjust your speed for the traffic conditions and don't follow other vehicles too closely. Be attentive to workers and machines in the work zone.

questions.question: When double solid yellow lines separate lanes of traffic:
questions.answerA: Passing is permitted from the left.
questions.answerB: Passing is permitted from the right.
questions.answerC: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separating lanes of traffic indicate that traffic is moving in opposite directions. Double solid lines indicate that passing is not permitted from either direction.

questions.question: Your body gets rid of approximately:
questions.answerA: Three alcoholic drinks an hour.
questions.answerB: One alcoholic drink an hour.
questions.answerC: Two alcoholic drinks an hour.
questions.explanation: The average person’s body will process about one alcoholic drink in one hour. However, many factors play a part in determining how impaired a person will become when consuming alcohol, including the amount of alcohol consumed, how fast it is consumed, and a person’s body weight, food intake, and general health.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: School crossing.
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.answerC: Jogging trail.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates the presence of a crosswalk, regardless of if it is marked on the pavement or not. Upon seeing this sign, you should be alert and allow any pedestrians to cross the road safely.

questions.question: While driving, you come upon a sign displaying the words “Reduced speed, 35 mph." This means:
questions.answerA: That the new 35 mph speed limit begins at this sign.
questions.answerB: That the new 35 mph speed limit begins at the next speed limit sign.
questions.answerC: That you have plenty of time to slow down before the reduced speed zone.
questions.answerD: That you should reduce your speed to 35 mph, but only under poor weather conditions.
questions.explanation: "Reduced speed" signs inform drivers that they must reduce their speeds. If a new speed limit is posted on one of these signs, the new speed limit begins at the sign.

questions.question: You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle:
questions.answerA: If the vehicle ahead is turning left.
questions.answerB: If there are two or more lanes traveling in your direction.
questions.answerC: Under no circumstances.
questions.explanation: You may never drive off the paved or main-traveled portion of the road and onto the shoulder to pass another vehicle.

questions.question: Roads freeze quickly when they are:
questions.answerA: Flat.
questions.answerB: Curvy.
questions.answerC: In the sun.
questions.explanation: In cold or wet weather, you should take special care on sections of road that are shaded by trees or buildings. These areas freeze more quickly than the rest of the road and are the last parts of the road to dry.

questions.question: When is it legal to drive above the posted speed limit?
questions.answerA: Never.
questions.answerB: When you don't see any other traffic in your lane.
questions.answerC: When you are passing another vehicle.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to ever exceed the posted speed limit, even for the purpose of passing another vehicle.

questions.question: Always signal when:
questions.answerA: Changing lanes.
questions.answerB: Pulling into or out of a parking space.
questions.answerC: Pulling into traffic from a parking area or alley.
questions.explanation: Your turn signals should always be used when you make any movement to the left or right. You should use your signal when pulling into traffic from a curbside parking space, moving into a new lane, or passing another vehicle.

questions.question: If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should:
questions.answerA: Not turn your steering wheel.
questions.answerB: Turn your steering wheel to the left to correct the skid.
questions.answerC: Turn your steering wheel to the right to correct the skid.
questions.explanation: If you begin to skid on a wet or icy road, take your foot off the accelerator, stay off the brakes, and turn your steering wheel in the direction of the skid. However, if you have anti-lock brakes, you should apply your brakes firmly and steer straight ahead.

questions.question: When driving in fog:
questions.answerA: Use your parking lights.
questions.answerB: Use your low beams.
questions.answerC: Use your high beams.
questions.answerD: It makes no difference which lights you use.
questions.explanation: You should use low beam headlights when driving in fog, rain, or snow.

questions.question: If two drivers arrive at the same time to a four-way intersection controlled by stop signs:
questions.answerA: The driver on the right has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The driver on the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: One driver may continue driving without stopping.
questions.answerD: One driver should honk to indicate that they are giving up the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: Yield the right-of-way to the driver on your right at a four-way intersection if you both arrive to the intersection at the same time. You may then proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Your current roadway ends ahead.
questions.answerB: You must bear either right or left.
questions.answerC: A four-way intersection is ahead.
questions.answerD: A road joins from the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a Y intersection ahead. You must bear either to the right or to the left.

questions.question: Which of the following about winter driving is not true?
questions.answerA: Winter is the most difficult driving season.
questions.answerB: Checking your vehicle's antifreeze and windshield washer fluid levels is especially important during the winter.
questions.answerC: Using cruise control in winter weather is a safe thing to do.
questions.answerD: It is best to use snow tires on your vehicle.
questions.explanation: You should not use cruise control on snow, in rain, in fog, or under similar hazardous conditions. Winter is the most difficult driving season and requires extra caution from drivers. It is important to consistently check your antifreeze and windshield washer fluid levels. Using snow tires can increase a vehicle's traction on the surface of slippery roads.

questions.question: Large trucks are likely to lose speed when:
questions.answerA: Driving up long or steep hills.
questions.answerB: Driving in long, gradual curves.
questions.answerC: Driving down long, gradual hills.
questions.explanation: Because large trucks require more time to accelerate than smaller vehicles, trucks can lose speed driving up long or steep hills. Be cautious when driving behind a large truck and be sure to give the vehicle additional space, especially when driving on an incline.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Watch for bicycles.
questions.answerB: Bicycles not allowed.
questions.answerC: Bicycle repair shop ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. Warning signs may alert drivers to areas where animals, people, and vehicles are likely to cross traffic.

questions.question: Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
questions.answerA: Tranquilizers, marijuana, and sedatives.
questions.answerB: Cough syrups and cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
questions.answerC: All of the above.
questions.explanation: A number of drugs can impair your ability to drive, including depressant medications like tranquilizers and sedatives; over-the-counter cough syrups, cold tablets, and allergy medications (which may contain impairing substances like alcohol, codeine, or antihistamines); and illegal drugs.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Lane ends.
questions.answerB: No right turn.
questions.answerC: Slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow and black. This sign tells drivers that a lane is ending and that they should prepare to allow traffic to merge safely.

questions.question: If you are driving and the rear end of your car starts skidding to the left, you should:
questions.answerA: Steer to the right.
questions.answerB: Steer to the left.
questions.answerC: Tap your brakes lightly and shift into neutral.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle enters a skid, you should take your foot off of the brake and steer in the direction that you want to go. For example, if the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should steer to the left. This will help bring the front of the vehicle in line with the rear, thereby straightening out the vehicle's overall direction.

questions.question: If you park facing uphill where there is no curb, set the parking brake and:
questions.answerA: Turn your wheels toward the edge of the road.
questions.answerB: Turn your wheels away from the edge of the road.
questions.answerC: Keep your wheels facing straight.
questions.explanation: When parking uphill on a road that does not have a curb, your front wheels should be turned to the right (toward the edge of the road). This will ensure that the vehicle will roll off of the road if the brakes fail.

questions.question: If the roadway is wet or icy, you should:
questions.answerA: Reduce your speed.
questions.answerB: Drive at the posted speed.
questions.answerC: Speed up.
questions.explanation: Because your tires will not grip the road under wet, snowy, or icy conditions as well as they will under dry conditions, you should slow down if the roadway is wet or icy.

questions.question: If you approach a traffic light with a red signal and a police officer directs you to go through the intersection without stopping, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop until the light turns green.
questions.answerB: Go through the intersection without stopping.
questions.answerC: Come to a complete stop before proceeding.
questions.explanation: Instructions given by police officers directing traffic always override posted traffic signals and signs. Follow the officer's instructions.

questions.question: As alcohol builds up in your blood, it:
questions.answerA: Slows down your reactions.
questions.answerB: Makes you feel less confident.
questions.answerC: Begins to metabolize itself more quickly.
questions.answerD: Decreases the number of driving errors.
questions.explanation: As alcohol builds up in your system, it will slow your reactions, make you feel more confident, and cause you to make more errors.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Winding road ahead.
questions.answerB: Do not enter.
questions.answerC: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a winding road ahead.

questions.question: Which of these is a safe driving technique?
questions.answerA: Using your high beam lights in the fog.
questions.answerB: Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.
questions.answerC: Checking your rearview mirrors frequently.
questions.explanation: To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

questions.question: At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if:
questions.answerA: You first come to a complete stop.
questions.answerB: You wait until the light changes.
questions.answerC: You are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.
questions.explanation: If you are in a lane corresponding to a signal displaying a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow when the way is clear. This is true whether the arrow is displayed alone or together with another signal.

questions.question: Night driving can be more difficult than driving during the day because:
questions.answerA: Cars overheat more quickly at night.
questions.answerB: Visibility is reduced in the dark.
questions.answerC: It is more likely to be raining at night.
questions.answerD: You are more likely to encounter a motorcycle at night.
questions.explanation: At night, your field of vision is reduced. To make sure you are able to react to hazards on the roadway, always use appropriate headlights. Drive slowly enough that you are able to stop within the distance that you can see ahead.

questions.question: Increase your following distance when driving behind a large vehicle:
questions.answerA: To better see around the sides of the vehicle.
questions.answerB: Because other drivers tend to pull behind large vehicles before trying to pass them.
questions.answerC: Because following too closely will get you caught in the vehicle's slipstream.
questions.explanation: Drivers of trucks, buses, vans, and any vehicles pulling campers or trailers may not be able to see you if you are driving directly behind them. Increase your following distance when driving behind one of these vehicles. Additionally, large vehicles can block your view of the road, so increase your following distance to look around the sides of the vehicle and see the road ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No passing zone.
questions.answerB: Slow-moving vehicle.
questions.answerC: Two-way traffic.
questions.explanation: A triangular yellow sign with black lettering indicates a no passing zone. It will appear on the left side of a two-way, two-lane roadway at the beginning of an area where prohibitive pavement markings are also used.

questions.question: It is very foggy. You should slow down and:
questions.answerA: Turn on your emergency flashers.
questions.answerB: Turn your lights to their high beam setting.
questions.answerC: Turn your lights to their low beam setting.
questions.explanation: Use your low beams when driving in fog, snow, rain, or mist. Light from high beams will reflect off of precipitation, causing a glare and making it even more difficult to see. Some vehicles are equipped with fog lights that should be used in addition to low beam headlights.

questions.question: You are driving at night and another vehicle is approaching from the opposite direction. Your headlights:
questions.answerA: Should be on their high beam setting.
questions.answerB: Should be on their low beam setting.
questions.answerC: Should be off. Use your parking lights.
questions.answerD: May be on either their high or low beam setting.
questions.explanation: Do not use your high beam headlights when approaching or following another vehicle at night. Switch to the low beam setting to ensure the safety of everyone on the road.

questions.question: You are driving on the roadway and hear a siren behind you. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop where you are.
questions.answerB: Pull over to the right and stop.
questions.answerC: Speed up to get out of the way.
questions.explanation: When you hear the siren or see the flashing lights of an emergency vehicle coming from behind your vehicle, you must create a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop. Reduce your speed and safely pull over to the side of the road. If the emergency vehicle is directly behind your vehicle when you are in heavy traffic, keep moving slowly until you can get out of its way.

questions.question: It is unlawful to:
questions.answerA: Pass another vehicle in any marked no passing zone.
questions.answerB: Pass another vehicle over a railroad crossing.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to cross the centerline to pass when driving on hills, in curves, and in other locations where you cannot see ahead far enough to pass safely. You may not pass at street crossings, at railroad crossings, where signs indicate no passing zones, or where a solid yellow line is next to your lane. You may not pass when the vehicle in front of you has stopped for a pedestrian or when driving in work zones where passing would be hazardous.

questions.question: When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
questions.answerA: Using the inside rearview mirror.
questions.answerB: Turning your head and looking over your shoulder.
questions.answerC: Using your side mirror.
questions.explanation: Even if your vehicle is properly equipped with mirrors, there are blind spots that cannot be seen by using the mirrors. Before changing lanes, look over your shoulder to check these areas.

questions.question: To turn left from multilane, one-way streets and highways, you should start from:
questions.answerA: The middle of the intersection.
questions.answerB: The right lane.
questions.answerC: The left lane.
questions.explanation: To turn left from multilane streets and highways, start from the left lane.

questions.question: If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, you should look toward ____ of the road.
questions.answerA: Either side
questions.answerB: The center
questions.answerC: The right side
questions.explanation: If a vehicle approaching you is using its high beams and fails to dim them, you should glance toward the right side of the road. This will keep you from being blinded by the other vehicle’s headlights and will allow you to see well enough to stay on your course until the vehicle passes.

questions.question: When driving to an unfamiliar area, you:
questions.answerA: Should depend on road signs to find your way.
questions.answerB: Should plan your trip in advance.
questions.answerC: Only have to know generally where your destination is.
questions.answerD: Should always choose the most direct route.
questions.explanation: When driving to an unfamiliar area, plan your trip in advance. Don’t start with only a hazy idea of where you are going. If your destination is in an unfamiliar area, check the location on a map before you start to drive.

questions.question: When in a travel lane on the roadway:
questions.answerA: You may stop to drop off passengers.
questions.answerB: You may stop to look up an address.
questions.answerC: You may make a U-turn or back up if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
questions.answerD: Don’t stop for any reason. Keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
questions.explanation: You should not stop in a travel lane for any reason. Instead, keep moving until you can safely pull off of the road. If you miss your turn or exit, do not back up. Go to the next turn or exit or where you can safely turn around.

questions.question: The effect that alcohol has on your reflexes and judgment:
questions.answerA: Is less pronounced when consuming beer instead of wine.
questions.answerB: Is less pronounced when consuming wine instead of beer.
questions.answerC: Is most pronounced when consuming hard ciders and mixed drinks.
questions.answerD: Depends on the amount of alcohol in your bloodstream.
questions.explanation: Consuming any type of alcohol can have negative effects on your reflexes and judgment. It does not matter which type of alcohol is consumed, only how much alcohol has entered a person's bloodstream.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Traffic signal ahead.
questions.answerB: Stop.
questions.answerC: Yield the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of of an approaching traffic signal.

questions.question: Which of the following is true regarding seat belts and child restraints in vehicles?
questions.answerA: You should never place an infant or small child in the front seat of a vehicle with airbags.
questions.answerB: An airbag can be dangerous to an infant or small child, even in a low-speed collision.
questions.answerC: You should always make sure all your passengers are using a seat belt or child restraint.
questions.explanation: Before you drive, always fasten your seat belt and make sure all your passengers are using seat belts or child restraints. Studies have shown that if you use seat belts, your chances of being hurt or killed in a traffic crash are greatly reduced. Children age 12 and under should always ride properly restrained in a rear seat. Never put a rear-facing infant restraint in the front seat of a vehicle with a front passenger airbag.

questions.question: If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
questions.answerA: Sound your horn.
questions.answerB: Wave your arms.
questions.answerC: Use your emergency lights.
questions.explanation: Your horn should be used to warn other drivers or pedestrians in situations where they may not see you. For example, if you think another driver is about to hit you, you should sound your horn.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Road construction/maintenance area.
questions.answerB: Side road.
questions.answerC: Railroad ahead.
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn of actual or possible hazards. The color orange is used for warning signs usually found in construction or maintenance areas.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Road widens ahead.
questions.answerB: Lane reduction; the right lane ends soon.
questions.answerC: Highway entrance ramp ahead.
questions.answerD: Lane reduction; the left lane ends soon.
questions.explanation: This sign indicate that the right lane ends ahead.

questions.question: You should allow an extra cushion of space:
questions.answerA: When following a station wagon.
questions.answerB: When following a driver who cannot see the rear of their vehicle.
questions.answerC: When following a small passenger car.
questions.explanation: Drivers of trucks, buses, vans, or any vehicles pulling campers or trailers may not be able to see you if you are driving directly behind them. Increase your following distance when driving behind one of these vehicles. Additionally, large vehicles can block your view of the road, so increase your following distance to look around the sides of the vehicle and see the road ahead.

questions.question: As you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light:
questions.answerA: Stop before crossing the intersection.
questions.answerB: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.answerC: Wait for a green light before proceeding.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means that you should slow down, check for cross traffic, and proceed with caution.

questions.question: The correct way to use a freeway exit ramp is to:
questions.answerA: Slow down before entering the exit ramp.
questions.answerB: Slow down once moving onto the exit ramp.
questions.answerC: Keep your speed constant once in the exit ramp.
questions.answerD: Pass slower traffic in the exit ramp.
questions.explanation: When using a freeway exit ramp, do not slow down until you move onto the exit ramp.

questions.question: Braking distance is affected by:
questions.answerA: The speed your vehicle is traveling.
questions.answerB: The condition of your brakes and tires.
questions.answerC: The condition of the pavement.
questions.explanation: Factors that can affect braking distance include how fast your vehicle is traveling, the condition of your brakes and tires, and the condition of the pavement.

questions.question: A broken yellow line down the center of a road indicates that:
questions.answerA: A construction zone is ahead.
questions.answerB: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.answerC: Passing is permitted from either direction.
questions.explanation: When broken yellow lines separate the lanes of traffic on a two-lane roadway, any driver may pass when there is no oncoming traffic.

questions.question: When approaching railroad tracks, you should:
questions.answerA: Look, listen, slow down, and be prepared to stop.
questions.answerB: Speed up to cross the tracks before the gate is lowered.
questions.answerC: Try to drive around a lowered gate.
questions.answerD: Not pay attention to how many tracks there are to cross.
questions.explanation: When approaching railroad tracks, you should look, listen, slow down, and be prepared to stop for trains or other vehicles that may be using the rails.

questions.question: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should:
questions.answerA: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.
questions.answerB: Test your tires' traction while going uphill.
questions.answerC: Decrease the distance you look ahead of your vehicle.
questions.explanation: A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.answerA: Yield sign.
questions.answerB: School crossing sign.
questions.answerC: Stop sign.
questions.explanation: A downward-facing triangular sign is always a yield sign. Drivers must be prepared to slow down or stop when approaching a yield sign.

questions.question: When you need to change lanes, it is important to:
questions.answerA: Signal your intentions ahead of the lane change.
questions.answerB: Check your blind spot.
questions.answerC: Make sure the lane is clear before entering.
questions.explanation: Always signal for an appropriate amount of time before making a lane change or exiting a freeway. Before you make any move to the right or left, quickly turn your head and look over your shoulder to see if your blind spot is clear.

questions.question: If you find yourself in a skid:
questions.answerA: Brake lightly.
questions.answerB: Stay off the brakes.
questions.answerC: Brake abruptly.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle begins to skid, do not use the brakes. Braking could make the skid worse.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerA: Slow down and prepare to stop if cars are approaching you.
questions.answerB: Come to a full stop then proceed when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Proceed carefully through the intersection, not always stopping.
questions.explanation: An octagonal sign always means stop. When approaching a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line and proceed only when it is safe to do so. If there is no stop line, stop before the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop before the intersection at a point from which you can see any oncoming traffic.

questions.question: Before turning left, it is important to:
questions.answerA: Sound your horn.
questions.answerB: Yield to oncoming vehicles.
questions.answerC: Swing to the right side of your lane.
questions.answerD: Wait until oncoming traffic has a red light.
questions.explanation: When turning left at a traffic signal, you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and oncoming traffic.

questions.question: A flashing yellow light at an intersection means you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.answerB: Come to a complete stop as quickly as possible.
questions.answerC: Stop and proceed only when the intersection is clear.
questions.explanation: When encountering a flashing yellow light at an intersection, you should slow down and proceed with caution. You do not need to come to a complete stop when approaching a flashing yellow light.

questions.question: To be safe when crossing a railroad, you should:
questions.answerA: Look both ways, but only when the red light is flashing.
questions.answerB: Listen, look both ways, and then proceed if it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Cross especially quickly when a train is approaching.
questions.answerD: Quickly pass under any lowering gates.
questions.explanation: Railroad crossings are always dangerous. Drivers should look and listen for an approaching train coming from either direction before proceeding across the tracks. Watch for signals indicating an approaching train and never proceed until you are certain it is safe to do so.

questions.question: Which is the most common cause of traffic crashes?
questions.answerA: New drivers
questions.answerB: Human error
questions.answerC: Bad weather
questions.explanation: Crashes often occur when one driver does not see another vehicle or when a driver does something unexpected. Communicate with other drivers on the road to help prevent traffic crashes.

questions.question: If you experience a tire blowout:
questions.answerA: Tap or pump the brakes.
questions.answerB: Slow down gradually and use your brakes lightly.
questions.answerC: Apply the brakes firmly and quickly.
questions.explanation: If you experience a tire blowout, you should slow down gradually by taking your foot off of the accelerator. Don't apply the brakes until the vehicle has slowed considerably.

questions.question: If you can see that the roadway up ahead is covered by heavy smoke, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn on your four-way flashers and continue.
questions.answerB: Reduce your speed, move as far to the right as possible, and stop off the roadway.
questions.answerC: Turn on your high beam headlights and continue.
questions.explanation: If you notice that the road ahead is covered by heavy smoke, reduce your speed immediately, drive as far as possible to the right, and stop off the roadway. Only then should you determine if it is safe for you to continue. Remember that certain kinds of smoke can irritate your eyes and lungs or even kill you.

questions.question: When entering traffic after being parked at a curb, you:
questions.answerA: Should drive more slowly than other traffic for 200 feet.
questions.answerB: Should wait for a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic.
questions.answerC: Should wait for the first two vehicles to pass, then drive into the lane.
questions.explanation: Any time that you merge into city or highway traffic, you should wait for a gap in traffic large enough for your vehicle to get up to the speed of other traffic.

questions.question: When you see a flashing yellow light at an intersection, you should:
questions.answerA: Yield to all traffic before crossing the intersection.
questions.answerB: Stop, then enter the intersection when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light at an intersection indicates that drivers should slow to a safe and reasonable speed and proceed with caution.

questions.question: You may be able to identify an aggressive driver by:
questions.answerA: Their erratic and improper lane changes.
questions.answerB: The number of passengers in their car.
questions.answerC: Their tendency to drive slowly.
questions.explanation: While driving, you should remain aware of the actions of surrounding drivers. If you notice an aggressive driver nearby making erratic or improper lane changes, you should not challenge them. The safest way to handle an aggressive driver is to get out of their way.

questions.question: Temporary signs used in construction and maintenance work areas:
questions.answerA: Have a red background with green writing.
questions.answerB: Have an orange background with black writing.
questions.answerC: Have a yellow background with blue writing.
questions.explanation: All temporary signs in work zones have orange backgrounds with black writing and/or symbols.

questions.question: When you are behind a motorcycle, you should:
questions.answerA: Be ready to use your horn.
questions.answerB: Drive more slowly.
questions.answerC: Allow a larger following distance.
questions.explanation: When following a motorcyclist, allow for at least a three- to four-second following distance. Motorcycles can stop quickly and following them too closely endangers your life and that of the motorcyclist. If the motorcyclist should fall, you need extra distance to avoid the rider. The chances of a fall are greatest on wet and icy roads, gravel roads, and metal surfaces such as bridges, gratings, and streetcar or railroad tracks.

questions.question: It is necessary for you to make an emergency stop. You should:
questions.answerA: Blow your horn at passing cars to let them know you have stopped.
questions.answerB: Get out of the vehicle once you have stopped.
questions.answerC: Turn on your emergency flashers and stay in your vehicle, if you can.
questions.explanation: If you need to stop due to vehicle trouble, get off of the road and away from traffic, if possible, and turn on your emergency flashers. Stay inside your vehicle to keep yourself safe from nearby traffic.

questions.question: It is dangerous to follow a motorcycle too closely because:
questions.answerA: They do not follow the same rules as motor vehicles.
questions.answerB: A motorcycle can stop much faster than a standard vehicle.
questions.answerC: They brake more slowly than motor vehicles.
questions.explanation: Motorcycles can stop quickly and following them too closely endangers your life and that of the motorcyclist. If the motorcyclist makes a mistake, you need to have enough time and space to avoid a crash.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Slow down or stop.
questions.answerB: Stop if necessary.
questions.answerC: You must come to a complete stop.
questions.explanation: An octagonal sign always means stop. When approaching a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line and proceed only when it is safe to do so. If there is no stop line, stop before the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop before the intersection at a point from which you can see oncoming traffic.

questions.question: You must yield for emergency vehicles:
questions.answerA: Under no circumstances.
questions.answerB: When you see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.
questions.answerC: Only when other vehicles yield.
questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren or flashing lights.

questions.question: Which of the following is a safe way to drive through a curve?
questions.answerA: Slow down as you enter, speed up as you exit.
questions.answerB: Maintain a constant speed throughout the curve.
questions.answerC: Speed up as you enter, slow down as you exit.
questions.answerD: Stay near the right edge of your lane.
questions.explanation: You should slow down as you enter a curve and increase your speed gradually as you exit. Increasing your speed as you enter a curve will make it more difficult to control your vehicle.

questions.question: When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
questions.answerA: You have the right-of-way and do not need to check for trains.
questions.answerB: You may pass slower drivers while crossing the track.
questions.answerC: You need to make sure there is space for your vehicle to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
questions.explanation: If you are following another vehicle at a railroad crossing, check to make sure you have enough room to get all the way across before you drive onto the tracks. You should never try to pass another vehicle as you approach or cross a railroad crossing. Always check for trains before crossing any railroad tracks.

questions.question: You are driving along a street and hear a siren. You cannot immediately see the emergency vehicle. You should:
questions.answerA: Keep driving until you see the vehicle.
questions.answerB: Pull to the curb and look to see if it is on your street.
questions.answerC: Slow down. Don't stop until you see it.
questions.answerD: Speed up and turn at the next intersection.
questions.explanation: If you hear a siren or an air horn close by but do not know exactly where the emergency vehicle is, safely pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure it is not headed toward you.

questions.question: When driving in work zones, you should:
questions.answerA: Increase your speed to get through the zone as quickly as possible.
questions.answerB: Reduce your speed and be prepared to stop suddenly.
questions.answerC: Maintain your normal speed the whole way through the zone.
questions.explanation: When entering and driving through a work zone, slow down and be prepared to stop. Obey posted speed limits and be alert to conditions around you. Workers could be present.

questions.question: When entering an interstate highway, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop, check for cars, and enter when safe.
questions.answerB: Check for cars and reduce your speed to 25 mph before entering the traffic lane.
questions.answerC: Check for cars, increase your speed to match the flow of traffic, and merge when the way is clear.
questions.explanation: Rather than stopping (as you would when entering other roads), you must use the merging or acceleration lane to speed up and smoothly merge with fast-moving traffic already on the interstate.

questions.question: When driving on major highways:
questions.answerA: Stay alert.
questions.answerB: Keep your eyes moving.
questions.answerC: Be ready to react to road hazards.
questions.explanation: It is important to stay alert on highways and be ready to react to unexpected hazards. To avoid "highway hypnosis," you should avoid looking at any one thing for more than a few seconds.

questions.question: A steady red arrow displayed on a traffic light means:
questions.answerA: Drivers cannot turn in the indicated direction.
questions.answerB: Drivers may turn in the indicated direction after coming to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: Drivers may turn in the indicated direction.
questions.explanation: If a traffic signal is displaying a steady red arrow, traffic in the indicated lane may not proceed in the direction shown by the arrow. Drivers must come to a full stop and wait for a green signal to proceed.

questions.question: Traffic signals sometimes display arrows to control turns from specific lanes. A solid yellow arrow:
questions.answerA: Is never used as a traffic signal.
questions.answerB: Has the same meaning as a circular yellow traffic light.
questions.answerC: Means that drivers may turn in the direction indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerD: Tells drivers that a green arrow is about to be shown.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow arrow has the same meaning as a yellow traffic light. When approaching a solid yellow arrow, you must reduce your speed and prepare for a red light.

questions.question: When two vehicles enter an intersection from different highways at the same time, which vehicle must yield the right-of-way?
questions.answerA: Either one
questions.answerB: The vehicle on the left
questions.answerC: The vehicle on the right
questions.explanation: At intersections that are controlled by signs or signals and at intersections that are uncontrolled, the driver on the left must yield the right-of-way to the driver on the right when two vehicles arrive to the intersection at the same time.

questions.question: A yellow light that flashes on and off means:
questions.answerA: Stop and look for other vehicles, then go if there is no traffic.
questions.answerB: Stop and wait for a green light.
questions.answerC: Speed up to clear the intersection quickly.
questions.answerD: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow traffic light means drivers should slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: When driving on slick roads, you should:
questions.answerA: Take turns more slowly than usual.
questions.answerB: Change lanes quickly.
questions.answerC: Accelerate quickly.
questions.explanation: While it is always dangerous to drive too fast on slippery roads, this is especially true when driving in turns and curves. Be sure to approach them more slowly in slippery conditions than you would under normal circumstances.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: School crossing.
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.answerC: Jogging trail.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates the presence of a pedestrian crossing. You should watch for people entering a crosswalk or crossing your path. Slow down and be prepared to stop.

questions.question: Which of the following must you obey over the other three?
questions.answerA: A steady red light
questions.answerB: A police officer
questions.answerC: A stop sign
questions.explanation: Directions given by traffic officers take precedence over signs, signals, and pavement markings. People authorized to direct traffic include police officers, fire police, highway work area flag persons, and school crossing persons.

questions.question: To be able to turn quickly, your hands must be:
questions.answerA: On opposite sides of the steering wheel.
questions.answerB: Next to each other on the top of the steering wheel.
questions.answerC: On the top and bottom of the steering wheel.
questions.explanation: Both hands should be placed on opposite sides of the steering wheel. This position is comfortable and promotes safe turning on high-speed roadways.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a 35 mph speed zone after the curve ahead.
questions.answerB: Drive no slower than 35 mph around the upcoming curve.
questions.answerC: Approach the upcoming curve at a speed of 35 mph or slower.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. These signs may be accompanied by speed advisory plaques that indicate the speed with which you should proceed.

questions.question: Various traffic control devices in construction and maintenance work areas are the color:
questions.answerA: Red.
questions.answerB: Orange.
questions.answerC: Yellow.
questions.explanation: Orange warning signs are used in and around work zones. Use special caution when you see orange signs, cones, or barriers on a roadway.

questions.question: While in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
questions.answerA: Illegal to either drink from or possess open containers of alcohol.
questions.answerB: Legal to drink alcohol if you're not driving.
questions.answerC: Legal to drink alcohol if you're driving but not drunk.
questions.explanation: It is illegal to operate a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol. Neither drivers nor passengers may possess an open container of alcohol in a motor vehicle while it is in operation.

questions.question: A double solid yellow line down the center of a two-lane road indicates:
questions.answerA: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerB: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerD: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines are used to separate traffic moving in opposite directions. Solid lines indicate that drivers are not permitted to pass.

questions.question: "No passing zone" signs tell drivers:
questions.answerA: To speed up slightly.
questions.answerB: That it is not safe to pass.
questions.answerC: To maintain a steady speed.
questions.explanation: If you come across a "No passing zone" sign, it is not legal to pass in the indicated area. You are likely driving in an area with restricted visibility where it would be unsafe to pass another vehicle.

questions.question: Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
questions.answerA: Yellow
questions.answerB: White
questions.answerC: Red
questions.explanation: Solid white lines are used to separate lanes traveling in the same direction (as well as to mark the right edge of the road). Broken white lines separate lanes traveling in the same direction and may be crossed to pass. Yellow lines separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Stop sign ahead.
questions.answerB: Railroad crossing ahead.
questions.answerC: Construction ahead.
questions.explanation: A round sign always indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Low clearance.
questions.answerB: Fines double in a work zone.
questions.answerC: No left turn.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching an area with low clearance.

questions.question: During the first nine months that a driver under the age of 18 has a probationary license, there are restrictions regarding:
questions.answerA: The type and number of passengers that may be in their car.
questions.answerB: Their purpose for driving between midnight and 5:00 a.m.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: If you are under age 18, you may drive alone and travel anywhere from 5:00 a.m. to midnight for the first nine months that you have a probationary license. Between midnight and 5:00 a.m., you may drive alone only if traveling between your home, school, and/or workplace. Regardless of the time, there are restrictions on how many passengers you may transport and who your passengers may be.

questions.question: When you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights, you must:
questions.answerA: Maintain your speed and stay in your lane until the vehicle has passed.
questions.answerB: Move into the right lane and drive slowly until the vehicle has passed.
questions.answerC: Pull over to the curb or edge of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
questions.explanation: If you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights, pull over to the right edge of the road and stop. Position yourself parallel to the curb. On one-way streets, drive toward the road edge nearest you.

questions.question: The posted speed limit shows:
questions.answerA: Only a recommended driving speed.
questions.answerB: The exact speed at which you must travel to avoid a ticket.
questions.answerC: The maximum safe driving speed under ideal road and weather conditions.
questions.answerD: The maximum safe driving speed under all road conditions.
questions.explanation: A speed limit sign shows the maximum legal driving speed for the stretch of highway where it is posted. Driving safely may require you to travel more slowly than the posted limit. When conditions are less than ideal, drivers should slow down.

questions.question: When driving in a construction zone:
questions.answerA: Slightly increase your speed.
questions.answerB: Expect the unexpected.
questions.answerC: Expect construction workers to yield to motorists.
questions.explanation: You may encounter unexpected conditions in a construction zone. For the safety of yourself, other drivers, and construction workers, drive with extraordinary caution.

questions.question: As you drive, you're required to stop your vehicle:
questions.answerA: At an intersection with a stop sign.
questions.answerB: Where there is a red light.
questions.answerC: When a traffic officer orders you to stop.
questions.explanation: Situations where motorists are required to stop include approaching intersections with stop signs, approaching intersections where a red light is either flashing or illuminated, or any time when a traffic officer orders your vehicle to stop.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Slow down or stop.
questions.answerB: Stop, if necessary.
questions.answerC: You must come to a complete stop.
questions.answerD: Drive with caution and be ready to stop.
questions.explanation: An eight-sided sign always means "stop." You must come to a complete stop and wait for any vehicles or pedestrians to clear the way before proceeding.

questions.question: ____ greatly increase stopping distances and severity of crashes.
questions.answerA: High speeds
questions.answerB: Slow speeds
questions.answerC: Night drives
questions.explanation: High speeds greatly increase stopping distances and severity of crashes. The faster you drive, the greater the impact or striking power of your vehicle, should you be involved in a collision.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: A divided highway ends.
questions.answerB: A one-way street begins.
questions.answerC: A one-way street ends.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead becomes a divided highway. Keep to the right of the divider or median.

questions.question: Any amount of alcohol in the blood may affect a driver's:
questions.answerA: Right-of-way privileges.
questions.answerB: Judgment and physical coordination.
questions.answerC: Knowledge.
questions.explanation: A driver’s ability to safely operate a vehicle may be impaired at any BAC level, even a level lower than the legal limit. Any amount of alcohol can affect one’s judgment and physical coordination. Driving under the influence of even a small amount of alcohol can lead to criminal charges.

questions.question: When a stop is required at an intersection and no markings appear to indicate a stop line or crosswalk, a driver:
questions.answerA: Is not required to stop.
questions.answerB: Is required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
questions.answerC: Should stop only at a place where they can see at least 200 feet on either side, even if they have to enter the intersecting roadway.
questions.answerD: Should stop where they have a clear view of approaching traffic before they enter the intersecting roadway.
questions.explanation: If there is no stop line or crosswalk, you should stop at the point nearest to the intersecting roadway where you can get a view of approaching traffic. You should not enter the intersecting roadway to gain a better view.

questions.question: How many alcoholic drinks does it take to affect your driving ability?
questions.answerA: Three
questions.answerB: Two
questions.answerC: One
questions.explanation: It is not advisable to drive after drinking any amount of alcohol. Even a single drink will affect your ability to drive safely.

questions.question: Your blind spot is the area of the road:
questions.answerA: You cannot see without moving your head.
questions.answerB: Directly behind your vehicle.
questions.answerC: You see in your rearview mirror.
questions.answerD: You see in your side mirror.
questions.explanation: Blind spots are areas that a driver cannot see without moving their head. They can be located to the sides of and behind a vehicle.

questions.question: Prior to entering a curve:
questions.answerA: Activate your turn signal.
questions.answerB: Reduce your speed.
questions.answerC: Brake hard.
questions.explanation: You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit. Some conditions which require reduced speed for safety include approaching curves or hills where visibility is limited, driving on slippery roads, and driving on roads where animals and pedestrians are present.

questions.question: If your car becomes disabled while on the highway, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop in the right lane.
questions.answerB: Park with all four wheels off the traveled highway, if possible.
questions.answerC: Stop where you are.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle becomes disabled, you must (if possible) park with all four wheels off of the main-traveled portion of the road.

questions.question: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead?
questions.answerA: When waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.
questions.answerB: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.
questions.answerC: When parked on the side of a level roadway where there is no curb.
questions.explanation: While waiting to turn left, keep your wheels pointed straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. If a vehicle hits you from behind, this will prevent you from veering into oncoming traffic. When parked facing either uphill or downhill, turn the wheels so the vehicle will not roll into traffic if the brakes fail.

questions.question: If you are under the age of 18, to qualify for a probationary license, you must:
questions.answerA: Have an instruction permit for at least six months.
questions.answerB: Have no moving traffic violations during the previous six months.
questions.answerC: Complete an approved driver education course.
questions.explanation: To obtain a probationary license, a person under 18 must complete an approved driver education class; have had an instruction permit for at least six months; accumulate 30 hours of certified behind-the-wheel driving experience (including 10 hours at night); have had no convictions for moving violations during the previous six months; pass a driving skills test; and pay required fees.

questions.question: Who must yield when a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light?
questions.answerA: Whoever started moving last
questions.answerB: The driver
questions.answerC: Whoever is slower
questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to pedestrians when they are crossing at any intersection without a traffic light, whether or not there is a crosswalk.

questions.question: Distracted driving is:
questions.answerA: Anything that causes evasive action while driving.
questions.answerB: Anything that takes your attention away from driving.
questions.answerC: Anything that causes you to pay more attention to driving.
questions.explanation: The term “distracted driving” refers to driving while anything takes your eyes, hands, or mind away from the task at hand. Distracted driving is the most common contributing factor to reported traffic collisions. Distractions of any sort cause drivers to miss key visual and audio cues needed to avoid a crash.

questions.question: Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
questions.answerA: Check your blind spots and mirrors.
questions.answerB: Signal your intention before changing lanes.
questions.answerC: All of the above.
questions.explanation: Every time you want to change lanes or otherwise move your vehicle to the right or left, signal to alert other drivers to your intentions. Always check your mirrors and turn your head to check your blind spot before attempting any lateral move.

questions.question: What does a single dashed white line separating traffic mean?
questions.answerA: Drivers may pass, even if it could be dangerous.
questions.answerB: Lanes move in opposite directions.
questions.answerC: Drivers may not pass.
questions.answerD: Drivers may pass if it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic that are moving in the same direction. Dashed white lines may be crossed to pass or change lanes, if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb, set the parking brake and:
questions.answerA: Turn the front wheels toward the curb.
questions.answerB: Turn the front wheels away from the curb.
questions.answerC: Leave the front wheels straight.
questions.explanation: When parking uphill on a road that has a curb, your wheels should be turned away from the curb. When parking uphill on a street without a curb or when parking downhill, your wheels should be turned toward the curb or edge of the road.

questions.question: When parking uphill on a hill or incline with a curb:
questions.answerA: Turn your front wheels sharply toward the curb.
questions.answerB: Turn your front wheels slightly to the right.
questions.answerC: Turn your front wheels sharply away from the curb.
questions.explanation: To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked facing uphill, turn your front wheels sharply away from the curb. If you are parking uphill on a street that has no curb, turn the wheels sharply toward the edge of the road.

questions.question: If you are driving so slowly that traffic is backing up behind you, you should:
questions.answerA: Decrease your speed.
questions.answerB: Pull off the right side of the road and let traffic pass.
questions.answerC: Not let the other cars pass your vehicle.
questions.explanation: Driving more slowly than the flow of traffic can be hazardous. If you are on a two-lane, two-way road and driving so slowly that traffic is backing up behind you, you are required to pull off the road and let the other vehicles pass. Only drive significantly under the speed limit when conditions require it.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: School zone or crossing.
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.answerC: Railroad ahead.
questions.explanation: A five-sided yellow or yellow-green sign alerts drivers to either a school zone or school crossing.

questions.question: When you are being tailgated:
questions.answerA: Move over to the right, if there is an open lane to your right.
questions.answerB: If there is not an open lane to your right, wait until the way is clear ahead and reduce your speed slowly to encourage the tailgater to drive around you.
questions.answerC: Never slow down abruptly.
questions.explanation: If you are being tailgated by another driver and there is a right lane, move over to the right. If there is no right lane, wait until the road ahead is clear and then reduce your speed slowly. This will encourage the tailgater to drive around you. Never slow down abruptly as this will only increase the risk of your vehicle being hit from behind.

questions.question: Traffic signals sometimes display arrows to control turns from specific lanes. A green arrow:
questions.answerA: Is used only on one-way streets.
questions.answerB: Has the same meaning as a circular green traffic light, but traffic must turn in the direction indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerC: Means that you may proceed, but only if the green arrow is accompanied by a circular green light.
questions.answerD: Points the way to an airport.
questions.explanation: A green arrow has the same meaning as a circular green traffic light, but traffic in the indicated lane must turn in the direction shown by the arrow.

questions.question: You are making a left turn from a two-way street onto a one-way street. When you have completed the turn, your car should be:
questions.answerA: In the right lane of the street.
questions.answerB: In the center of the street.
questions.answerC: In the left lane of the street.
questions.answerD: In the lane with the least traffic.
questions.explanation: If you are turning left from a two-way street onto a one-way street, you should complete the turn into the lane closest to the lane you have just left.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead.
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing ahead.
questions.answerC: Pedestrians must not cross here.
questions.answerD: Be alert for construction workers on the road.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates the presence of a pedestrian crossing. Drivers should be cautious when driving where pedestrians may be present.

questions.question: If you need to drive in foggy weather:
questions.answerA: Turn on your low beam headlights.
questions.answerB: Turn on your hazard lights.
questions.answerC: It is okay to drive at the maximum speed limit.
questions.answerD: Do not drive at a speed above 10 miles per hour.
questions.explanation: You are required to use your headlights during the day when visibility is reduced to 500 feet or less. When you first turn on your headlights, be sure they are adjusted to the low beam setting. Using high beams in fog or rain will cause the light to reflect back into your eyes, lowering visibility even more.

questions.question: What message will be found on this yellow pennant-shaped sign?
questions.answerA: Right turns only.
questions.answerB: Right turns permitted.
questions.answerC: No passing zone.
questions.explanation: Pennant-shaped yellow signs like this are used to indicate a no passing zone.

questions.question: If an aggressive driver cuts you off, you should:
questions.answerA: Call the police immediately.
questions.answerB: Stay calm and move out of the aggressive driver's way.
questions.answerC: Flash your vehicle's lights to let the aggressive driver know he is wrong.
questions.answerD: Use a driving action of your own to get back at the aggressive driver.
questions.explanation: If an aggressive driver cuts you off on the roadway, stay calm and get out of their way. Trying to get even with an aggressive driver risks escalating the situation and increasing the danger.

questions.question: Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
questions.answerA: Make no driving errors.
questions.answerB: Have trouble driving slowly.
questions.answerC: Are better drivers because they are not hungry.
questions.explanation: Choosing to eat, drink, or smoke while driving is dangerous because these actions require a driver to remove their hands from the wheel and their eyes from the road. Drivers who engage in distracting activities while driving have trouble staying in their lanes and controlling their vehicles.

questions.question: A vehicle hydroplanes when the:
questions.answerA: Windshield wipers cannot keep the windshield clear of rain.
questions.answerB: Tires lose contact with the road surface.
questions.answerC: Spray from a large truck reduces visibility.
questions.explanation: When a vehicle is moving too quickly on a wet surface, the tires can lose all contact with the road surface, causing the vehicle to glide along on the surface of the water. This is referred to as "hydroplaning."

questions.question: To avoid glare from the headlights of an approaching car:
questions.answerA: Look briefly toward the right side of the road.
questions.answerB: Stay focused on the centerline on the road.
questions.answerC: Flash your high beams.
questions.explanation: You should avoid looking toward the bright lights of an oncoming vehicle by glancing toward the right side of the road. After looking briefly toward the side of the road, continue looking ahead to check on the position of the other vehicle.

questions.question: When turning left at an intersection:
questions.answerA: You should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
questions.answerB: Oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.
questions.answerC: You should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
questions.explanation: When turning left at an intersection, yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic and pedestrians. Once the intersection is clear and applicable signals allow, you may complete the turn.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Slippery when wet.
questions.answerB: Watch for drunk drivers.
questions.answerC: Dangerous curve ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign warns drivers to be extra careful when the pavement is wet because the road may become slippery, making vehicles more difficult to control.

questions.question: To drive safely at night, you should:
questions.answerA: Increase your following distance.
questions.answerB: Not drive if you are tired.
questions.answerC: Make sure your headlights are working properly.
questions.explanation: At night, visibility is reduced. Take steps to make driving in the dark more safe for you and the other drivers on the road.

questions.question: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
questions.answerA: Make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
questions.answerB: Cautiously drive around the pedestrian.
questions.answerC: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
questions.explanation: Drivers must always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in the roadway, even if there is not a marked crosswalk.

questions.question: You are approaching an intersection at the posted speed limit when the signal turns yellow. You should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and proceed through the intersection without caution.
questions.answerB: Speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.
questions.answerC: Stop before entering the intersection, if you can do so safely.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow light means "caution" and signals that the light will soon turn red. You should stop at a solid yellow light if you can do so safely; otherwise, you should cautiously cross the intersection.

questions.question: A flashing red light on a traffic signal means:
questions.answerA: The same thing as a stop sign.
questions.answerB: The traffic signal is broken.
questions.answerC: You do not have to come to a complete stop.
questions.explanation: A flashing red light means the same thing as a stop sign. If you encounter a flashing red light, you should come to a complete stop, yield to appropriate traffic and pedestrians, and only proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Cars in the right lane must slow down.
questions.answerB: No left turn.
questions.answerC: Merge.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that there could be traffic merging from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow traffic to safely merge.

questions.question: You are entering a crowded freeway. What should you do to merge into traffic?
questions.answerA: Use your side and rearview mirrors and check your blind spots.
questions.answerB: Use the acceleration lane to adjust your speed to match the speed of freeway traffic.
questions.answerC: Yield to traffic already on the freeway.
questions.explanation: Use the entrance ramp to accelerate to the speed of freeway traffic and yield to traffic already using the freeway. Before entering traffic, use your mirrors and check your blind spots to verify that you have room to safely merge.

questions.question: This sign indicates that the road ahead:
questions.answerA: Turns sharply right, then left.
questions.answerB: Curves right, then left.
questions.answerC: Curves right.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a reverse curve in which the road curves to the right, then to the left.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.answerA: It is okay for drivers of other vehicles to follow motorcycles closely.
questions.answerB: A motorcycle with two people on it is more balanced than a motorcycle with just one rider.
questions.answerC: The driver of a passenger vehicle must change lanes completely when passing a motorcycle.
questions.answerD: Drivers of other vehicles can expect a motorcycle's brake lights to turn on when the motorcyclist slows down.
questions.explanation: Motorcycles are entitled to the width of a full lane. Be sure your vehicle is entirely in the left lane before attempting to pass a motorcycle on the left.

questions.question: As you enter into a roundabout, you should slow down and:
questions.answerA: Yield to any crossing pedestrians and bicyclists.
questions.answerB: Yield to any car already within the roundabout.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: When entering a roundabout, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, and traffic already in the roundabout.

questions.question: As you near an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. Your best action is to:
questions.answerA: Speed up to beat the red light.
questions.answerB: Apply the brakes sharply to stop.
questions.answerC: Be prepared to stop in the center of the intersection.
questions.answerD: Be prepared to stop before the intersection.
questions.explanation: A steady yellow traffic light indicates that the light will soon change to red. You should be prepared to stop for the red light, if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When stopped for a traffic violation or at an equipment check, the driver must produce:
questions.answerA: Proof of insurance.
questions.answerB: Their license.
questions.answerC: Proof of registration.
